t: Job 32
Elihu in Anger Rebukes Job
Then*p these three men ceased answering Job, because he was righteous in his own eyes.
But the anger of Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite, of the family of Ram burned; against Job his anger burned because he justified himself before God.
And his anger burned against his three friends because they had found no answer, and yet had condemned Job.
Now Elihu had waited to speak to Job because they were years older than he.
And when Elihu saw that there was no answer in the mouth of the three men his anger burned.
So*p Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite spoke out and said, “I*pn am young in years and you are old; Therefore*ln I was shy and afraid to tell you what I think.
I*ln thought age should speak, And*ln increased years should teach wisdom.
But*ln it is a spirit in man, And*ln the breath of the Almighty gives them understanding.
The*ln abundant in*i years*i may not be wise, Nor*ln may elders understand justice.
So*ln I say, ‘Listen to me, I*ln too will tell what I think.’
“Behold,*ln I waited for your words, I*ln listened to your reasonings, While*ln you pondered what to say.
I*ln even paid close attention to you; Indeed,*ln there was no one who refuted Job, Not*ln one of you who answered his words.
Do*ln not say, ‘We*ln have found wisdom; God*ln will rout him, not man.’
For*ln he has not arranged his*i words against me, Nor*ln will I reply to him with your arguments.
“They*ln are dismayed, they no longer answer; Words*ln have failed them.
Shall*ln I wait, because they do not speak, Because*ln they stop and*i no longer answer?
I*ln too will answer my share, I*ln also will tell my opinion.
For*ln I am full of words; The*ln spirit within me constrains me.
Behold,*ln my belly is like unvented wine, Like*ln new wineskins it is about to burst.
Let*ln me speak that I may get relief; Let*ln me open my lips and answer.
Let*ln me now be partial to no one, Nor*ln flatter any*i man.
For*ln I do not know how to flatter, Else*iln my Maker would soon take me away.
